title: A Parallel Workflow for Polar Sea-Ice Classification using Auto-labeling of Sentinel-2 Imagery
abstract: arXiv:2403.13135v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: The observation of the advancing and retreating pattern of polar sea ice cover stands as a vital indicator of global warming. This research aims to develop a robust, effective, and scalable system for classifying polar sea ice as thick/snow-covered, young/thin, or open water using Sentinel-2 (S2) images. Since the S2 satellite is actively capturing high-resolution imagery over the earth's surface, there are lots of images that need to be classified. One major obstacle is the absence of labeled S2 training data (images) to act as the ground truth. We demonstrate a scalable and accurate method for segmenting and automatically labeling S2 images using carefully determined color thresholds. We employ a parallel workflow using PySpark to scale and achieve 9-fold data loading and 16-fold map-reduce speedup on auto-labeling S2 images based on thin cloud and shadow-filtered color-based segmentation to generate label data. translated_title: 使用自动标注 Sentinel-2 图像的并行工作流程进行极地海冰分类
translated_abstract: 极地海冰覆盖的推移和退缩模式的观测是全球变暖的重要指标。本研究旨在开发一个稳健、有效且可扩展的系统，利用 Sentinel-2（S2）图像对极地海冰进行分类，如厚雪覆盖、年轻薄冰或露水。由于S2卫星在地球表面积极捕捉高分辨率图像，有许多需要分类的图像。一个主要障碍是缺乏标记的S2训练数据（图像）作为基准。我们展示了一种可扩展且准确的方法，利用精心确定的颜色阈值对S2图像进行分割和自动标注。我们使用 PySpark中的并行工作流程，在基于薄云和阴影过滤的基于颜色的分割的基础上，实现了9倍数据加载和16倍 MapReduce 加速，用于自动标注 S2 图像以生成标签数据。
tldr: 该研究提出了一种并行工作流程，利用自动标注 Sentinel-2 图像的方法，采用颜色阈值实现了极地海冰的分类，解决了缺乏标记数据的问题。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a parallel workflow for polar sea-ice classification using auto-labeling of Sentinel-2 imagery, overcoming the challenge of lack of labeled data by utilizing carefully determined color thresholds.
